alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:47PM EDT until July 23 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of moderate to locally heavy rainfall impacting much of central Berkeley County, including Moncks Corner Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have already fallen in some areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Ridgeville, Pinopolis, Old Santee Canal State Park, Murraysville, Whitesville, Sugar Hill, Berkeley County Airport, Saint Johns, Chicora, Oakley, New Hope, Stony Landing, Simpson Crossing, Macbeth, Wadboo, Mepkin, Hussertown, Ellwood and Old Cordesville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
